1.text: Choose 1 player to deal 3 cards to each player.

2.text: Place the remaining cards face-down and flip over the top card from the pile.

3.text: Say “The name of the game is Mao” if you’re the dealer.

4.text: Play a card from your hand that matches the suit or rank of the center card.

5.text: Draw a new card if you’re unable to play.

6.text: Continue gameplay in a clockwise direction.

7.text: Decide on a set of rules to follow before starting the game.

8.text: Skip over the next player if someone puts down an ace.

9.text: Take an extra turn if you put down a 2.

10.text: Pick up a card if the previous player puts down a 7.

11.text: Play in the opposite direction if someone puts down an 8.

12.text: Declare a new suit if you put down a Jack.

13.text: State the exact card you’re putting down if your card is a spade.

14.text: Say “one card” if you only have a single card left in your hand.

15.text: Discard identical cards at any point in the game.

16.text: Thank any player who penalizes you.

17.text: State “penalty for” if another player breaks the rules.

18.text: Take 1 card from the deck if you’re penalized.

19.text: Place your cards down if someone says “point of order.

20.text: State “Mao” or “Mao Mao” when playing the final card in your hand.

21.text: Add 3 cards to your hand if you put a Jack on top of another Jack.

22.text: Pick up an extra card if you curse during the game.

23.text: Take a card if you discuss or explain the game rules.
